image_alt_text: A postcard with the photo of Hotel Del Monte
object_transcript: We arrived here June 7 - & expect to stay over Sunday. The prices are stiff and accommodations ordinary.Tables also ordinary. [???] the spot is naturally beautiful and everybody feels obliged to see it. Santa Barbara is the place for a long stay, all the prices every where go up feb 1st - they take outrageous advantage of the tourist season, Feb  and march are the packed months and a big season according to the newspapers - [???] ann.

Your card to hand and glad to know you got there and are enjoying yourself.
I start on the old job again after my pleasant visit. Look out for the gold bricks. [????] Erika Arthur

image_alt_text: A postcard with a text about rememberance
object_transcript: Let me hear from you soon. Am coming to Parsons, Kans. either in Nov. or Jan. Wish I might see you.Any hopes, do you think? Best wishes - Hyette

title: Elsie Westerman's response to her lover Frank Westerman's Christmas postcard
creator: Elsie Westermann
description: A postcard with a New Year text
subject: Westermann's Family; Holiday's postcard
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.
image_alt_text: A postcard with a New Year text
object_transcript:
Dear Frankie:
We received all your pretty Xmas cards and wish to thank you for them - especially your dear picture you sent to me. We all had a very Merry Xmas and hope you had the same.
Wishing you a  Happy New Year!
 Hope it won’t be long now before we see you.
Same as ever, Elsie

Chicago, Dec. 28, 1911
I wish you all a very joyous and New Year.
Hope to see you this summer.

With love,
Your cousin,
Emma

title: Harriett Westerman's response to her son Frank's San Francisco postcard

image_alt_text: A postcard with a photo of seagulls
object_transcript:
Dear Son Frank,
received a card from you from Frisco. Was glad to hear from you and to know you are on the back track.
You did not give any address — please write address very plainly.
Give regards to Con.
Hope you are both well.
We are quite well.

title: Tina's postcard addressed to Frank Westerman
creator: Tina
description: A  postcard with a text
subject: Westermann's Family
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.
image_alt_text: A  postcard with a text
object_transcript:
Have your mom [???] over yet?
How are they coming?
How far is Richmond Utah from S.L.C.?
I was out to Hannah yesterday, and Con’s mother and sisters were there also.
Enjoyed ourselves.
– Tina

image_alt_text: A postcard with a photo of the Capitol in the night
object_transcript:
Miss Thomas,
I’m grateful for this opportunity given to me to be here in Washington. 
It’s just thrilling to me to be in such a historical place and with this host of Red X workers. Best Wishes

title: Alma's postcard addressed to Frank Westerman
creator: Alma
description: A postcard with Hollenbeck Parl
subject: Westermann's Family; Landscapes

image_alt_text: A postcard with Hollenbeck Parl
object_transcript:
"Congratulations"
Rec. your card some few days ago, was very glad to hear from you – waiting for more information in regards of your card.
 We are all very well, hope you all are the same.
Still having lovely weather.
Go down to the beach every Sunday
Write me and tell me all the good news

Seattle, Washington, Feb. 6, 1911

Dear Frank: 

Found another "set " for you again. This is the first one from Lovey - will send another to-morrow.

With love from 
 Elsie

image_alt_text: A postcard with a photo of new municipal buildings
object_transcript:
Belchertown
Dear sister, — Mamma has will send a letter tomorrow.
Doesn't it seem nice to get some rain.
We are all well and hope you are the same! It is lovely and cool here today. I am going berrying this afternoon.
Must close and send this along.
Love,
L. M. J.

title: Ruth's postcard to her friend Blanche Boyer
creator: Ruth
description: A postcard with a photo of the Boston Medical College
subject: Landscapes
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. Digital reproduction permissions granted by University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department. For other uses beyond free use, please contact University of Idaho Library Special Collections and Archives Department at libspec@uidaho.edu.
image_alt_text: A postcard with a photo of the Boston Medical College
object_transcript:
Baltimore, 1916
Now Blanche, be sure and write to me soon for I like to hear from the folks up home.
I like this work fine.
Dear Friend Blanche,
This is the hospital where I am at and now when you come down here I want you to be sure and come around to see me.
If you come down here to visit your Aunt and stay any time at all why just call up here or if not why come around anyway even if only for a few minutes time.
From your friend,
Ruth

Oh! Kenneth — Look!
5th Journey — thru John LAAF — San Angelo, Texas.
Dear Pal —
I thought you perhaps you would like this card. This place here seems quite like home after being in Texas.

Dresden, Lindenplatz(?) 4
5/2/1912
Many thanks for your dear card and your kind thoughts, and good wishes. Please give my kindest regards to [??] and the [??] [??]. Much love from yours Clara Shadowell, We got a beautiful winter.

title: Clara Shadowell's postcard from Dresden
creator: Clara Shadowell
description: A postcard with a photo showing the city of Dresden
subject: Landscapes
rights: Educational use includes non-commercial use of text and images in materials for teaching and research purposes. image_alt_text: A postcard with a photo showing the city of Dresden
object_transcript:
Hello Everybody,
I shall have to postpone my visit but I’m not going to be discouraged by that, us girls were going down next Fri (next day after the -unclear- here. But Gladys has the mumps or something of the sort, not a bit sick but her face is swollen, so if all is in our favor we will be down next Tue or Wed.

title: Postcard addressed to everybody about Gladys having the mumps

image_alt_text: A postcard showing a scenery from Lisbon Portugal
object_transcript:
June 13/ 27
My Dear Mrs. Chomer,
Here we are in this beautiful old city of Nurnberg. I thought maybe you would like to have a card from me from Germany. I sent one to you from Austria. Kindest regards to Mrs. Haltzermann and also to you.Sincerely yours, Mrs. Denver

image_alt_text: A Christmas postcard with text
object_transcript:
German Transcription:
Viele liebe Grüße aus Frömmstadt senden: Heinz
 Jorge
 Ilse
 Hermin
Liebe Grüße Mimi
[Signatures]
 T. Hammer, Roland, J. Hilti,
 Günther Faiß, Bilgi,
 Inesari (or a similar name – unclear handwriting)
English Translation:
Many warm greetings from Frömmstadt from:
 Heinz
 Jorge
 Ilse
 Hermin
Best regards,
 Mimi
[Signatures]
 T. Hammer, Roland, J. Hilti,
 Günther Faiß, Bilgi,
 Inesari (uncertain due to handwriting)
